info.title: Azure Maps Data Registry Service
info.description: APIs for managing data registry in Azure Maps.

AADToken.description:
These are the [Azure Active Directory OAuth2](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/v1-overview) Flows. When paired with [Azure role-based access](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/role-based-access-control/overview) control it can be used to control access to Azure Maps REST APIs. Azure role-based access controls are used to designate access to one or more Azure Maps resource account or sub-resources. Any user, group, or service principal can be granted access via a  built-in role or a custom role composed of one or more permissions to Azure Maps REST APIs.

To implement scenarios, we recommend viewing [authentication concepts](https://aka.ms/amauth). In summary, this security definition provides a solution for modeling application(s) via objects capable of access control on specific APIs and scopes.

#### Notes
* This security definition **requires** the use of the `x-ms-client-id` header to indicate which Azure Maps resource the application is requesting access to. This can be acquired from the [Maps management API](https://aka.ms/amauthdetails).
* 
The `Authorization URL` is specific to the Azure public cloud instance. Sovereign clouds have unique Authorization URLs and Azure Active directory configurations. 
* 
The Azure role-based access control is configured from the [Azure management plane](https://aka.ms/amrbac) via Azure portal, PowerShell, CLI, Azure SDKs, or REST APIs.
* 
Usage of the [Azure Maps Web SDK](https://aka.ms/amaadmc) allows for configuration based setup of an application for multiple use cases.
* Currently, Azure Active Directory [v1.0 or v2.0](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/azure-ad-endpoint-comparison) supports Work, School, and Guests but does not support Personal accounts.

AzureKey.description:
This is a shared key that is provisioned when creating an [Azure Maps resource](https://aka.ms/amauth) through the Azure management plane  via Azure portal, PowerShell, CLI, Azure SDKs, or REST APIs.

 With this key, any application is authorized to access  all REST APIs. In other words, these can currently be treated as master keys to the account which they are issued for.

 For publicly exposed applications, our recommendation is to use server-to-server access of Azure Maps REST APIs where this key can be  securely stored.
AzureKey.name: subscription-key

SasToken.description:
This is a shared access signature token is created from the List SAS operation on the [Azure Maps resource](https://aka.ms/amauth) through the Azure management plane via Azure portal, PowerShell, CLI, Azure SDKs, or REST APIs.

 With this token, any application is authorized to access with Azure role-based access controls and fine-grain control to the expiration, rate, and region(s) of use for the particular token. In other words, the SAS Token can be used to allow applications to control access in a more secured way than the shared key.

 For publicly exposed applications, our recommendation is to configure a specific list of allowed origins on the [Map account resource](https://aka.ms/amauth) to limit rendering abuse and regularly renew the SAS Token.
SasToken.name: SAS Token

ApiVersion.name: api-version
ApiVersion.description: Version number of Azure Maps API.

UniqueDataId.name: udid
UniqueDataId.description: The unique data id for the data registry. The `udid` must have been obtained from a successful long-running [DataRegistry Register API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/register) call.

OperationIdQuery.name: operationId
OperationIdQuery.description: The ID to query the status for the data upload request.

values.description: Delete the data registry without deleting the underlying content stored in customer's storage account.
Delete the data registry as well as the underlying content stored in customer's storage account.

put.description:
**Applies to:** see pricing [tiers](https://aka.ms/AzureMapsPricingTier).

The endpoint of DataRegistry APIs is bound to the region of your maps account. Global maps account is not able to use this service.

The DataRegistry Register API allows the caller to register their data content uploaded to Azure Storage Account in the Azure Maps Service and get the `udid` representing the registered data content.

You can use this API in scenarios like registering a collection of Geofences in `GeoJSON` format for use in [Azure Maps Geofencing Service](https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/maps/spatial), or registering a set of DWG design files as a zipped [Drawing Package](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-maps/drawing-requirements) for use in [Azure Maps Creator Conversion Service](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/v2/conversion).

## Submit Register Request

To register your data you will use a `PUT` request. The request body will contain the connection object. The `dataFormat` query parameter will contain the format for the data for validation purpose.

For example, to register a collection of geofences  in `GeoJSON` format, set the request body to the connection object representing how Azure Maps can access your geojson file. Set the `dataFormat` query parameter to _geojson_.

The DataRegistry Register API performs a [long-running request](https://aka.ms/am-creator-lrt-v2).

parameters.name: dataRegistry
parameters.description: The data registry to be registered.

201.description: Resource Creating: The request has been accepted for processing. Please use the URL in the Operation-Location Header to obtain status.

Operation-Id.description: ID of the status monitor for the operation.

Operation-Location.description: New URL to check for the results of the long running process. `api-version` is not included in the URL.

get.description:
**Applies to:** see pricing [tiers](https://aka.ms/AzureMapsPricingTier).

The endpoint of DataRegistry APIs is bound to the region of your maps account. Global maps account is not be able to use this service.

This API allows the caller to fetch a list of all data registries registered previously using the [DataRegistry Register API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/register).

## Submit List Request

To list all your map data content you will issue a `GET` request with no additional parameters.

## List Response

The Data List API returns the complete list of all data in `json` format.

200.description: List data request completed successfully. The response body contains a list of all the previously uploaded data.

put.description:
**Applies to:** see pricing [tiers](https://aka.ms/AzureMapsPricingTier).

The endpoint of DataRegistry APIs is bound to the region of your maps account. Global maps account is not be able to use this service.

The DataRegistry Update API allows the caller to update a previously registered data registry.

You can use this API in a scenario like adding or removing geofences to or from an existing collection of geofences. Geofences are registered using the [DataRegistry Register API](https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/maps/data-registry/register), for use in the [Azure Maps Geofencing Service](https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/maps/spatial).

## Submit Update Request

To update your content you will use a `PUT` request. The request body will contain the new connection object that will replace the existing connection object. The path will contain the `udid` of the data to be update.

For example, to update a collection of geofences that were previously registered, set the `udid` in the query parameter and the new connection object in the body.

The DataRegistry Update API performs a [long-running request](https://aka.ms/am-creator-lrt-v2).

parameters.name: dataRegistry
parameters.description: The object for updating a given data registry

200.description: Resource Replacing: The request has been accepted for processing. Please use the URL in the Operation-Location Header to obtain status.

Operation-Id.description: ID of the status monitor for the operation.

Operation-Location.description: New URL to check for the results of the long running process. `api-version` is not included in the URL.

patch.description:
**Applies to:** see pricing [tiers](https://aka.ms/AzureMapsPricingTier).

The endpoint of DataRegistry APIs is bound to the region of your maps account. Global maps account is not be able to use this service.

The DataRegistry Patch API allows the caller to patch a previously registered data registry.

You can use this API in a scenario like adding or removing geofences to or from an existing collection of geofences. Geofences are registered using the [DataRegistry Register API](https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/maps/data-registry/Register), for use in the [Azure Maps Geofencing Service](https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/maps/spatial).

## Submit Patch Request

To patch a data registry you will use a `PATCH` request. The request body will contain an object representing a patch to the data registry, in [JSON Merge Patch (RFC7396)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7396). The path will contain the `udid` of the data registry to be update.

For example, to patch a data registry that were previously registered, set the `udid` in the query parameter and the new connection object in the body.

The DataRegistry Patch API performs a [long-running request](https://aka.ms/am-creator-lrt-v2).

parameters.name: dataRegistryPatch
parameters.description: The object for patching a given data registry

202.description: Request Accepted: The request has been accepted for processing. Please use the URL in the Operation-Location Header to obtain status.

Operation-Id.description: ID of the status monitor for the operation.

Operation-Location.description: New URL to check for the results of the long running process. `api-version` is not included in the URL.

get.description:
**Applies to:** see pricing [tiers](https://aka.ms/AzureMapsPricingTier).

The endpoint of DataRegistry APIs is bound to the region of your maps account. Global maps account is not be able to use this service.

This API allows the caller to download the underlying content of a previously registered data registry.

You can use this API in a scenario like downloading an existing collection of geofences registered previously using the [DataRegistry Register API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/register) for use in our [Azure Maps Geofencing Service](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/spatial).

## Submit Download Request

To download your content you will use a `GET` request where the path will contain the `udid` of the data to download.

For example, to download a collection of geofences previously registered, set the `udid` in the query parameter.

## Download Response

The Download API will return a HTTP `200 OK` response if the data resource with the passed-in `udid` is found, where the response body will contain the content of the data resource. A HTTP `400 Bad Request` error response will be returned if the data resource with the passed-in `udid` is not found.

200.description: Data download request completed successfully. The response body will contain the content for the passed in `udid`.

Content-Type.description: The content-type for the Download API response.

delete.description:
**Applies to:** see pricing [tiers](https://aka.ms/AzureMapsPricingTier).

The endpoint of DataRegistry APIs is bound to the region of your maps account. Global maps account will not be able to use this service.

This API allows the caller to unregister a previously registered data registry. Default is to unregister the data registry without deleting the underlying data in caller's storage account but you can specify `deleteMode=hard` in query parameter to make it delete the underlying data (requires MSI to hold proper permission to the storage account).

You can use this API in a scenario like unregistering geofences previously registered using the [DataRegistry Register API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/register) for use in our [Azure Maps Geofencing Service](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/spatial), or unregistering a zipped DWG design files which was used in [Azure Maps Creator Conversion Service](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/v2/conversion).

## Submit Unregister Request

To unregister a data registry you will issue a `DELETE` request where the path will contain the `udid` of the data registry to unregister.

For example, to unregister a collection of geofences previously registered, set the `udid` in the query parameter. Specify `deleteMode=hard` in query parameter if you want to also delete the content of the collection of geofences.

## Unregister Response

The Data Delete API returns a HTTP `204 No Content` response with an empty body, if the data registry was unregistered successfully.

A HTTP `400 Bad Request` error response will be returned if the data registry with the passed-in `udid` is not found.

204.description: Data registry unregister request completed successfully. The data registry was unregistered in Azure Maps Service.

get.description:
**Applies to:** see pricing [tiers](https://aka.ms/AzureMapsPricingTier).

The endpoint of DataRegistry APIs is bound to the region of your maps account. Global maps account is not be able to use this service.

This API allows the caller to fetch the metadata of a given udid registered previously using the [DataRegistry Register API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/register).

## Submit Get Metadata Request

To fetch the metadata of a given udid you will issue a `GET` request with no additional parameters.

200.description: Get metadata request completed successfully. The response body is the metadata of a given udid.

get.description:
The endpoint of DataRegistry APIs is bound to the region of your maps account. Global maps account is not be able to use this service.

This path will be obtained from a call to [DataRegistry Register API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/register), [DataRegistry Update API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/update), and [DataRegistry Patch API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/maps/data-registry/patch). While in progress, a HTTP `200 OK` response will be returned with no extra headers -  followed by a HTTP `200 OK` with `Resource-Location` header once completed.

## Get Metadata Response

The Data Metadata API returns the complete list of all data in `json` format.

200.description: The operation is running or complete. If the operation was successful, use the Resource-Location header to obtain the path to the result.

Resource-Location.description: If successful, a URI where details on the newly registered resource can be found.

DataRegistry.description: A DataRegistry object provides information for Azure Maps Service to access customer's resources.

description.description: The description to be given to the data registry. The max length is 1024 characters.

DataRegistryPatch.description: An object for patching a given data registry.

description.description: The description to be given to the data registry. The max length is 1024 characters.

Connection.description: A Connection object representing how Azure Maps Service accesses customer's resources and the scope of it.

msiClientId.description: ClientId of MSI. Use system assigned identity if not provided.

linkedResource.description: The linked resource. Need to configure in control plane beforehand.

blobPath.description: The path to the blob file.

ConnectionPatch.description: A ConnectionPatch object represents a patch to a Connection object, in [JSON Merge Patch (RFC7396)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7396).

msiClientId.description: ClientId of MSI. Use system assigned identity if not provided.

linkedResource.description: The linked resource. Need to configure in control plane first.

blobPath.description: The path to the blob file.

MapDataListResult.description: The response model for the Data List API. Returns a list of all the previously registered data.

mapDataList.description: A list of all the previously registered data.

MapDataResult.description: The response model for the Data Metadata API. Returns the metadata of a given udid.

udid.description: The unique data id for the data registry.

downloadURL.description: The download url of the data. Execute a HTTP `GET` on the prepended endpoint to download the data. `api-version` is not included.

sizeInBytes.description: The size of the content in bytes.

contentMD5.description: The content MD5 of the content.

DataFormat.description: Data format of the uploaded content for validation purpose.

values.description: [GeoJSON](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946) is a JSON based geospatial data interchange format.
